channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 3 people involved in Minnesota church protest arrested; judge rejects charges against journalist
item.description: Protesters on Sunday entered the Cities Church in St. Paul, where a local official with U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement serves as a pastor. A...

item.title: Heart disease deaths declined. And here's how to reduce your risk of the #1 killer
item.description: An annual report from the American Heart Association shows deaths from heart disease and stroke are down, encouraging news after the rate went up in t...

item.title: Trump signs Board of Peace charter at Davos as allies split on Gaza plan
item.description: The signing ceremony marked the most concrete step yet in Trump's effort to establish the board, whose final composition has yet to be confirmed.

item.title: Trump sues JPMorgan Chase and CEO Jamie Dimon for $5B over alleged 'debanking'
item.description: The lawsuit escalates a series of confrontations between the president and the leader of the country's biggest bank.

item.title: A vast Syrian camp for ISIS families faces an uncertain fate after a security handover
item.description: The huge al-Hol camp in northeastern Syria for years has posed an intractable problem — a destitute and increasingly dangerous detention site where IS...

item.title: Maine’s governor demands data on immigration arrests as fear spreads amid enforcement surge
Microsoft investigating outage affecting Microsoft 365, Outlook
item.description: Microsoft services are down for thousands of users, according to tracking service Downdetector.

item.title: 3 people involved in a Minnesota church protest are arrested, as judge refuses to charge Don Lemon
item.description: Attorney General Pam Bondi says a woman who led an anti-immigration enforcement protest that disrupted a service at a Minnesota church has been arrest...

item.title: Josh Shapiro on VP vetting process: "Offensive" to question my loyalty to this country
item.description: Josh Shapiro, the Democratic governor of Pennsylvania, writes in his upcoming memoir, "Where We Keep the Light," that he was asked during the vetting ...

item.title: 'It's all about the land': Zelensky says Ukraine to talk to US and Russia
item.description: The meeting came as US envoy Steve Witkoff headed to Moscow for a meeting with Russia's Vladimir Putin.

item.title: Federal officers detain a 5-year-old boy who a school official says was used as ‘bait’
France seizes suspected Russian 'shadow fleet' oil tanker in the Mediterranean
item.description: The vessel, named Grinch, was stopped by the French navy as it travelled through waters between Spain and Morocco.

item.title: German nurse jailed for murders could be linked to 100 more deaths
item.description: Prosecutors are reviewing dozens more suspected deaths linked to a former palliative care nurse.

item.title: What we know about Trump's 'framework of future deal' over Greenland
item.description: Denmark and Greenland have made it clear they will not relinquish sovereignty of the world's largest island.

item.title: House voting on final funding measures to avoid partial shutdown
item.description: The House is voting Thursday on the remaining bills to fund the government as the deadline to avoid another shutdown nears.

item.title: Brothers who were in Hamas captivity since the October 7 attacks speak out
item.description: Brothers David Cunio and Ariel Cunio, who were kidnapped by Hamas during the Oct. 7, 2023, attacks and held hostage in Gaza for two years, joined CBS ...

item.title: ICE detains 5-year-old and father in Minnesota, lawyer says
item.description: The boy was taken along with his father, the lawyer and school officials say. ICE says it was not targeting the boy.
